dc:title:
From Union Square to Rome,
Chapter 6 - New York Dorothy Day 1838, Chapter 6, pp. 61-70. Recounts the misery of New York in 1916, her loneliness, and life in tenements among the ethnic poor. Describes her first newspaper job with The Call, the competing social ideologies, and sporadic strikes and protests. DDLW #206 1938-01-08 James Allaire Creative Commons Non-Commercial Share Alike 3.0 en-US http://www.catholicworker.org/dorothyday/daytext.cfm?TextID=206
